newsitem.title: GREECE: Ergobank holders meet on rights issue Tues.
newsitem.headline: Ergobank holders meet on rights issue Tues.

text.p: Private Ergo Bank will hold a shareholders' meeting on Tuesday, November 19 on its planned 27.3 billion drachma rights issue, it said in a statement.
The shareholders' meeting will take place at 1900 local at the Hilton hotel, Ergo Bank said.

Its board will seek shareholder approval for a rights issue of 2,880,000 shares at 9,500 drachmas a share. The terms for shareholders of record on Tuesday will be three new shares for every 20 outstanding.
The issue includes 162,000 shares earmarked for the bank's staff also at 9,500 drachmas a share.

Ergo Bank will also seek approval for a bonus share issue of 4,200,000 shares arising from a capitalisation of reserves. It will distribute two bonus shares for every 10 outstanding. The new shares from the rights issue will be entitled to the bonus distribution.

"For example, a shareholder of 200 shares at today's close may participate in the rights issue for another 30 shares at 9,500 drachmas a share. The resulting 230 shares will become 276 with the bonus distribution of another 46 shares," Ergo Bank said.
Ergo Bank shares closed up 3.44 percent or 420 drachmas at 12,615 on Monday as the market rebounded 2.74 percent to 914.82 points. --George Georgiopoulos, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
